metadata.title: Let Bartlet Be Bartlet
metadata.time_reference: During Bartlet's first term in office

releases.details: The West Wing: The Complete First Season
special_features: Commentary by Creator Aaron Sorkin and Cast

releases.details: The West Wing: The Complete Series
special_features: All previously released special features plus more

notes: This episode deals with political strategy and internal strife within the Bartlet administration.
It is the first of a continuing plot line addressing the 'Don't Ask, Don't Tell' policy.

in_universe_mythology: The importance of continuing political reform within government structures.
Themes of loyalty and betrayal within political circles.
real_world_cultural_references: Federal Election Commission's role in the American political system.

continuity_notes: This episode explores ongoing character development for Bartlet and his administration staff.
The events are set during Bartlet's first term, which affects the political dynamics presented.

plot.plot_summary: Amid rumors of a damaging memo regarding President Bartlet’s weaknesses, staff scramble to mitigate its fallout. C.J. discovers the memo came from someone within their trusted circle, prompting her to confront the issue directly with the reporter involved. Simultaneously, Sam and Toby engage with military officials to discuss the controversial 'Don't Ask, Don't Tell' policy, while Josh proposes replacing FEC commissioners. Tensions rise as the President's approval rating drops, culminating in Leo's urging for Bartlet to take decisive action, leading to the rallying cry: 'Let Bartlet Be Bartlet.'
